description.value:
Teleportation

  • You and up to eight willing creatures of your choice, or a single object you can see within range, are transported instantly to a destination you describe. The destination must be on the same plane of existence.

  • The accuracy of your arrival depends on how familiar you are with the destination and whether you have an associated object from there. The DM rolls on the Teleport Table.

  • When you teleport, roll [[/r 1d100]]. The result depends on your familiarity with the destination. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplTeleportMi]{Teleportation Outcome}

    • On Target: You appear exactly where you intended.

    • Off Target: You arrive [[/r 1d10*1d10]] percent of the distance away in a random direction from your intended destination.

    • Similar Area: You arrive in a different area that closely resembles the target area (such as another temple to the same god, or a guildhall with similar layout).

    • Mishap: You and each creature or object teleported take [[/damage 3d10 force]] damage, and the DM rerolls on the table to determine the outcome. Repeated mishaps are possible.


Familiarity Categories

  1. Permanent Circle: A teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know.

  2. Associated Object: A reliable object taken from the desired location within the last six months.

  3. Very Familiar: A place you have been often and carefully studied.

  4. Seen Casually: A place you have seen more than once but not studied.

  5. Viewed Once: A place you have seen once, possibly using magic.

  6. Description: A place you know only by description.

  7. False Destination: A place that doesnâ€™t exist or you misidentify.
